page.title: 02LOW WORSALL VILLAGE
page.content: Low Worsall was recorded in the original Domesday Book as Worfal. Over the centuries it changed very little until pre 1939-45 war,when a water supply,other than wells,was installed and electricity came after the war.Originally the village was situated around the village green.Post-war building of residential houses developed south of the village on either side of the access road,leading to the village green. At one time the village green had a paddock and served the community as common ground. At present the green of Low Worsall is used purely for social purposes such as Bonfire night parties and sports days for the village children.
